TopicTitle: Waffles vs french toast! Who will win.

Articles.Content:
WAFFLES.

OR

FRENCH TOAST

DECIDE >:3

Waffles are the best because they hold the syrup in nice uniform squares.

Pancakes and french toast are inferior.

I love pancakes and waffles.

French toast just feels... soggy.

That waffles picture looks .... !

So waffles all the way, also I don't even know these "French toast" you are talking about to be honest ^^

French toast, no contest.

IT'S DRENCHED IN EGG FOR GOSHSAKES. Delicious with real maple syrup.

aaand waffles lead by a 4 point lead.

im suprised i thought people would like french toast more.

I'm a waffle guy myself, although I wind up making French toast a lot because it is my 4-year-old daughter's favorite.

I don't even know these "French toast" you are talking about to be honest ^^

Pain perdu, we eat it for breakfast in America.
Oh I get it now, thanks a lot

While waffles are good, I'll go with french toast... I make the best.

On the other hand, Waffles! is (was) a codeword ... but none of my MJ's or FoK brothers are around here to see it.

real maple syrup.

That's one hell of a typo. It's spelled "syrup".

That's one hell of a typo. It's spelled "syrup".

You're not talking about corn syrup with some bullsh*t artificial flavoring in it, are you?

You're not talking about corn syrup with some bullsh*t artificial flavoring in it, are you?

No, of course not.

There's "syrup", which is made from maple sap, and there's "stuff-that-should-never-be-poured-on-french-toast". I've heard the second one in made from corn.

No, of course not.

There's "syrup", which is made from maple sap, and there's "stuff-that-should-never-be-poured-on-french-toast". I've heard the second one in made from corn.

Nothing else compares to "real" Maple syrup. I've a friend who lives in Maine, taps her own sugar Maples in her yard and boils down her own... talk about good stuff!
That is not the French Toast I know and love...

Dassault French Toast.

That is, toasted targets after a brushfire war.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Waffles. It's like pancakes, but easier to use.

Btw,

Do we like waffles!!!????

Between the two, waffles. Because... they're waffles!

Our house actually prefers pancakes, mainly because a) they're easier to make without having to buy, store, and clean uniquely-dedicated hardware, and we have some really awesome pancake recipes.

A more difficult choice for me would be pancakes vs. Belgian waffles. Oh, god, Belfian waffles... That sweet, crispy goodness (no matter what you put on top!) is nigh-unparalleled.
um, I vote for pancakes

french toast is superior.

i tend to frown on things that require special purpose cooking gadgets to make. where as my electric griddle can make many things (some of those things are bacon), such as french toast (and bacon). pancakes are a thing i make when i dont have the stuff to make french toast (which is also superior to regular toast).

the only thing more superior to french toast is bacon.

i dont use syrup.

Edited December 16, 2014 by Nuke

French toast, (regular) bacon, with real maple syrup. (Canada, eh?)

I hear nice maple syrup is nigh impossible to get down in the lower parts of the U.S.

Waffles are nice, but if you cut them too small you lose the "that one bite with a ton of butter and syrup" effect. Cut them too large and you'll regret taking that bite.

Meanwhile, french toast just absorbs everything, so you don't have to worry about all that.

Advantage, french toast.

Edited December 16, 2014 by Norpo
clarified that it's "regular" bacon not canadian bacon

Boy, is that even a choice?

French toasts for the french toast god!

Maybe it's because I've never eaten good waffles, but french toasts with maple syrup are just way more delicious.

Edited December 16, 2014 by mrrpamplemousse

OK, time to rock the boat, going with Crepes, CREPES!!!!

Seriously though, waffles trumps them all. Especially Belgian waffles.
and french toast leads by one point.
French toast = better for you ... all natural ingredients (can be made so), unlike 'processed' waffles... unless your waffle/pancake batter is one you make yourself from scratch. French toast FTW!

I hear nice maple syrup is nigh impossible to get down in the lower parts of the U.S.

We can get the stuff down here, but it's expensive. The artificially flavored cane/corn muck they tend to eat around here not only tastes bad, but it gives me a headache.
